p: With two worldwide epidemics causing close to 10 million cases all together during the 21 st Century, chikungunya virus is undoubtedly a re-emerged disease threatening both tropical and temperate regions [ 2, 3, 4]. While it was a neglected tropical disease until the early 2000s, it has since gathered considerable interest as the number of publications through the years illustrates ( Figure 2). In contrast, ONN, MAYV, and RRV are still understudied, even though specialists consider them as a Sword of Damocles. Indeed, some reviews raise the question of a possible emergence in the near future [ 186, 254, 255, 256, 257], especially for ONNV, which is known to have caused a large African outbreak with a hundred thousand cases in 1959â€“1962 [ 38].
